body: @ymyronov Are there any trends in the crashes? Only for certain manufacturers or certain versions of Android?

not really, I can't see any trends:
[image](https://ibb.co/jZCkPa)

*It does correspond to overall device distribution
I suspect it might be something to do with devices that have systemAnimations disabled as we had issues on those before. (systemAnimationsAreDisabled property in LottieDrawable)

@ymyronov Are you doing anything funny with threading? We haven't seen in production nor have I heard any other reports.
Digging into the code, it's trying to clone a listener inside of ValueAnimator.
@ymyronov onBind and onRecycled are not analogous methods. Bind can get called many times before it's recycled. This may be causing your issue.
@ymyronov Can you attach a sample project that repros this?

In LottieDrawable, if systemAnimationsAreDisabled is true, it will cancel the animator immediately.
In ValueAnimator.cancel(), it will call notifyStartListeners() if the animation has not run yet, before calling onAnimationCancel().

Thus, you should not remove animator listeners at onAnimationStart(). 

To reproduce this crash, do:
1. remove animator listeners at onAnimationStart(), and 
2. go to Settings to disable system animation.

ref:
http://grepcode.com/file/repository.grepcode.com/java/ext/com.google.android/android/5.1.1_r1/android/animation/ValueAnimator.java#ValueAnimator.cancel%28%29
https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/blob/master/lottie/src/main/java/com/airbnb/lottie/LottieDrawable.java#L69
Sorry guys, a bit busy those days... will come back to you shortly
@Kane-Shih I can't repro this by following those two steps. If you could attach a repro project, that would be great.
